content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
Neutral regime — normal volatility with very narrow participation. Vol: 26.1%. Breadth: 1/8 sectors positive (narrow).

2. Which sectors are leading?
Banking & Finance is the lone leader and is ABOVE TREND: AKBNK (1W: +1.46% | 1M: +13.25%) ABOVE TREND, YKBNK (1W: +3.12% | 1M: +12.45%) ABOVE TREND, VAKBN (1W: +2.68% | 1M: +21.45%) ABOVE TREND, HALKB (1W: +3.61% | 1M: +8.00%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Transportation and Technology are the weakest and are in CORRECTION/B ELOW TREND: TAVHL (1W: -10.38% | 1M: -2.63%) BELOW TREND, KONTR (1W: -10.29% | 1M: +3.65%) CORRECTION, PGSUS (1W: -9.42% | 1M: +0.45%) CORRECTION, THYAO (1W: -8.77% | 1M: +5.18%) CORRECTION.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
Top performers led by Energy and Heavy names: TRMET (1W: +12.60% | 1M: +15.15%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +11.40% | 1M: +11.50%) ABOVE TREND, EREGL (1W: +8.73% | 1M: +14.64%) ABOVE TREND, ASELS (1W: +5.78% | 1M: -3.79%) RECOVERY, HALKB (1W: +3.61% | 1M: +8.00%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
Biggest losers this week: TAVHL (1W: -10.38% | 1M: -2.63%) BELOW TREND, KONTR (1W: -10.29% | 1M: +3.65%) CORRECTION, PGSUS (1W: -9.42% | 1M: +0.45%) CORRECTION, THYAO (1W: -8.77% | 1M: +5.18%) CORRECTION, TSKB (1W: -8.45% | 1M: -2.03%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Upside momentum: TRMET (1W: +12.60% | 1M: +15.15%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +11.40% | 1M: +11.50%) ABOVE TREND, EREGL (1W: +8.73% | 1M: +14.64%) ABOVE TREND. Downside momentum: TAVHL (1W: -10.38% | 1M: -2.63%) BELOW TREND, KONTR (1W: -10.29% | 1M: +3.65%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banking shows narrow leadership but is extended; sector is ABOVE TREND on 1W and 1M breadth. Key names: AKBNK (1W: +1.46% | 1M: +13.25%) ABOVE TREND, YKBNK (1W: +3.12% | 1M: +12.45%) ABOVE TREND, VAKBN (1W: +2.68% | 1M: +21.45%) ABOVE TREND, GARAN (1W: -0.38% | 1M: +5.24%) CORRECTION, TSKB (1W: -8.45% | 1M: -2.03%) BELOW TREND.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry is mixed with clear divergence between leaders and laggards. EREGL (1W: +8.73% | 1M: +14.64%) ABOVE TREND and ASELS (1W: +5.78% | 1M: -3.79%) RECOVERY are outperforming while VESTL (1W: -8.22% | 1M: -1.87%) BELOW TREND and FROTO (1W: -6.26% | 1M: +11.13%) CORRECTION show weakness.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy shows idiosyncratic moves; top names are strong but several names roll over. TRMET (1W: +12.60% | 1M: +15.15%) ABOVE TREND and TRALT (1W: +11.40% | 1M: +11.50%) ABOVE TREND lead, while SASA (1W: -7.95% | 1M: -2.80%) BELOW TREND and HEKTS (1W: -7.20% | 1M: +0.31%) CORRECTION lag.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Neutral stance — favor selective long exposure to high-quality banks and momentum industrial/energy winners, trim vulnerable transportation and smaller cyclical names. Keep position sizing disciplined and maintain a cash buffer for rotation-driven opportunities.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
Watch EREGL (1W: +8.73% | 1M: +14.64%) ABOVE TREND for follow-through, TRMET (1W: +12.60% | 1M: +15.15%) ABOVE TREND for energy momentum, ENKAI (1W: +2.60% | 1M: +22.07%) ABOVE TREND for construction flow, KONTR (1W: -10.29% | 1M: +3.65%) CORRECTION as a volatility play.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Banking for leadership confirmation and Energy & Chemicals for idiosyncratic breakout/fade risk. Monitor Transportation for further downside risk and volatility spillover.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 reaction to global risk cues and local macro data; market is sensitive to CBRT communication, CPI prints, and oil prices as immediate catalysts. Technical triggers: watch for follow-through above recent swing highs for leaders and failure to reclaim those levels as a trigger to reduce cyclicals.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Neutral market with normal volatility but very narrow breadth; leadership concentrated in banks and select energy/heavy industrial names. Opportunities reside in high-quality banking names and momentum winners like TRMET and EREGL, while transportation, small-cap tech and select chemicals warrant defensive trimming.
